channel.title: Clojurescript on Floyd Hightower
channel.description: Recent content in Clojurescript on Floyd Hightower

item.title: Informed, Random Walk
item.description: Background Stripe Press published a beautiful copy of “The Art of Doing Science and Engineering” by Richard Hamming: Aside from being a wonderful read, the cover of this book (which is an apt analogy for the learning process) features an intriguing pattern. As I was reading the book while traveling, I was thinking about what algorithm would make such a pattern. This post is an explication of my solution. An Informed, Random Walk Such a pattern could be created from what I am calling an “Informed, Random Walk”.
